page.title: 03ESKDALEMUIR SHEEP FARMING
page.content: Just as the introduction of sheep to the area in the 13th century led to the slow removal of the mainly deciduous primeval forest so the introduction of re_afforestation in 1938 by the Forestry Commission and again in 1965 by the Economic Forestry Group resulted in dramatic decrease in the numbers of sheep. Nevertheless,on the lower slopes of the valley well established sheep farms remain stocked with Cheviots and to a lesser extent Blackfaces. With an exceptionally hardy constitution and a very adaptable nature both these breeds do well. Pedigree rams and ewes are bred and sold .Sheep are given sheep feed and mineral blocks throughout the two months before lambing which takes place in April and May and sold at lamb sales in August and September.
